newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: SOCCER-CHILAVERT INSPIRES VELEZ TO SUPERCUP FINAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CHILAVERT INSPIRES VELEZ TO SUPERCUP FINAL.

text.p: Argentine champions Velez Sarsfield drew 1-1 with Santos to reach the South American Supercup final on Thursday after another piece of inspiration from goalkeeper Jose Luis Chilavert.
Chilavert set up the Velez goal in the 26th minute with a 70 metre clearance from his penalty area that landed on the foot of striker Martin Posse.
Posse eluded a Santos defender and then fired the ball past goalkeeper Edinho into the net for a goal of stunning simplicity.
Santos striker Robert equalised for the Brazilian team in the 78th minute of the semi-final, second leg game but Velez went through to the final thanks to a 2-1 win in Brazil two weeks ago.
Chilavert scored the winner from the penalty spot in the first game to claim his eighth goal of the year. The tally includes four penalties and four free kicks.
On Sunday, one of his huge kicks upfield set up the only goal of the game as his country Paraguay beat Ecuador 1-0 in a World Cup qualifier.
Velez meet two times Supercup champions Cruzeiro of Brazil in the final of the tournament, which features past winners of the Libertadores Cup.
